main event: An unidentified object was sighted moving slowly and then exploding near Cape Town, South Africa on July 2, 1965.
interesting points: The object was described as circular, larger than 1 meter in diameter, and disintegrated with multiple flashes and explosions., No sound accompanied the sighting, which occurred in clear weather conditions., The object moved easterly before exploding., Observers included the Second Officer and Master of the research and supply ship 'R.S.A.', The event was evaluated as a meteor observation.
sighted object: an unidentified object, described as bluish-gray and similar in size to a small orange
witness description: S. O. Stigant, Second Officer, and S. T. McNish, Master, from the vessel 'R.S.A.'
